metadata.dc:author: Builes-Montaño, Carlos
Perez, Christian
Valderrama, Carlos
I Gómez, Carlos
metadata.dc:description: Infection is the most serious complication of arthroplasty. It's a rare event usually caused by Staphylococcus spp. Prosthetic tuberculosis is rarely reported. We report the case of a 41 year-old patient who underwent a hip replacement for osteoarthritis and after multiple procedures an infection caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis was documented. We review the literature of previously reported cases.
metadata.dc:title: Infección por Mycobacterium tuberculosis en una prótesis de cadera, reporte de un caso y revisión de la literatura.
[Mycobacterium tuberculosis infection in a hip prosthesis, a case report and literature review].
metadata.dc:publisher: Revista chilena de infectologia : organo oficial de la Sociedad Chilena de Infectologia
